decks.notes: The main focus of this UW Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and maintaining board control. The deck includes a variety of counterspells like Mana Leak and Dovin's Veto, removal spells like Path to Exile and Wrath of God, and card advantage engines like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently answering threats and generating card advantage, ultimately leading to victory through attrition and control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly combo off by using Allosaurus Rider's ability to cheat out Autochthon Wurm or Griselbrand, and then using Eldritch Evolution or Neoform to further improve board presence. The deck focuses on utilizing various spells and creature abilities to create a powerful board state and win the game in a quick and efficient manner. By utilizing cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Manamorphose, the deck aims to generate mana and draw through the deck while assembling the necessary pieces for the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp, Faithless Looting, and Life from the Loam in order to trigger powerful graveyard effects like Bloodghast, Prized Amalgam, and Narcomoeba. By utilizing cards like Cathartic Reunion and Shriekhorn to dig through the deck and put cards into the graveyard, the deck can quickly set up explosive plays with Conflagrate and Creeping Chill. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a constant stream of threats from the graveyard, creating a relentless and fast-paced combo strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers to slow down the opponent's strategy while building card advantage and generating value through card draw and selection. The deck aims to stabilize the board with creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Wall of Omens, as well as control the opponent's threats with cards like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict. The planeswalkers, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, provide additional control options and win conditions to secure victory in the late game.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through counterspells, removal, and planeswalker abilities. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage with card draw and planeswalker abilities. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to outvalue the opponent in the late game. Additionally, it has access to board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Wrath of God to reset the board if necessary. Overall, the deck aims to control the game's tempo and grind out a win through card advantage and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through high-power creatures and filling the graveyard, then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's board with Fulminator Mage and Architects of Will while setting up for a massive board presence with creatures like Archfiend of Ifnir and Horror of the Broken Lands. The deck also includes removal spells like Beast Within to handle problematic permanents. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and combo off for a game-winning attack.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Stinkweed Imp using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting. By dredging cards back into the hand with Life from the Loam, the deck can trigger effects like Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill to put pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures and direct damage, while also having some control elements with Conflagrate and Darkblast. The mana base includes fetch lands and shock lands for consistency.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient spells and creatures. By utilizing cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear, along with burn spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to deal consistent damage and pressure the opponent early on. The inclusion of cards like Boros Charm, Lightning Helix, and Skullcrack also provides flexibility and reach in order to finish off the opponent quickly. The mana base is streamlined to support the aggressive strategy of the deck.

The deck aims to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. It uses powerful planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the game and threaten opponents. The deck also includes large threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine to close out games decisively. The main goal is to outvalue opponents by utilizing the Tron lands efficiently, while disrupting their game plan with removal and threats.

The deck focuses on assembling UrzaTron (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is used to cast powerful colorless threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Karn Liberated. The deck also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to deal with opposing threats. The goal is to control the game by ramping up quickly and overpowering the opponent with big threats while disrupting their game plan.

The main theme of this deck is to maintain control over the opponent's resources while gradually building up card advantage and board presence. It achieves this through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers such as Teferi and Narset. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan through countering key spells, controlling the battlefield with board wipes, and drawing cards to ensure consistency. By playing a reactive game and constantly disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to outlast and outvalue its opponent in the long run.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana, allowing for powerful late-game plays. It utilizes control elements like counterspells, removal, and disruptive artifacts to stall the opponent and protect its win conditions. The main win conditions include Karn, the Great Creator, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also has ways to tutor for specific cards with Expedition Map and Tolaria West, ensuring consistency in finding key pieces. Its overall strategy is to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

The main strategy of this deck is to utilize the graveyard as a resource by constantly milling cards from the library and then bringing back powerful creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam. Cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate also synergize well with this strategy, dealing damage and controlling the board. Utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Life from the Loam to constantly fill the graveyard and set up powerful combos is key to the deck's success. Additionally, cards like Narcomoeba and Stinkweed Imp add additional value and options for the player.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage through infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, supported by pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth. The goal is to win the game by getting ten poison counters on the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck also includes protection spells like Spell Pierce and Vines of Vastwood to ensure the infect creatures can get through safely. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with fetch lands and dual lands.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam, allowing you to recur them easily. By cycling through your deck with cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting, you can trigger powerful effects like Creeping Chill and Life from the Loam. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with creatures and burn spells, while also controlling the board with cards like Darkblast and Blast Zone.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Human creatures with disruptive abilities to control the board and overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing Aether Vial and cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Reflector Mage, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building a strong battlefield presence with cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish. The efficient mana base and creature selection allow for consistent aggression and versatility in combat, making it a powerful choice for aggressive players looking to apply early pressure and maintain tempo throughout the game.
